definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The machine is named after its inventor.
sentences.chinese: 這臺機器以其發明者的名字命名。

sentences.english: The contract binds the company to pay royalties to the inventor.
sentences.chinese: 合同使這家公司必須付給發明者專利權使用費。

sentences.english: The dish was originally named after the inventor Ding Baozhen, whose title was Kung Pao.
sentences.chinese: 這道菜起初是以它的發明者丁寶楨命名的。

sentences.english: A patent gives inventors exclusive rights to their inventions for a fixed period of time.
sentences.chinese: 專利授予發明者對其發明在一定時期內的專有權。

sentences.english: Edison, the inventor of light, was said to be stupid when he was young.
sentences.chinese: 電燈的發明者愛迪生在幼年時曾被認爲很愚鈍。

sentences.english: And each of them was invented by people who were in their 20s.
sentences.chinese: 而且每一項的發明者當時都是20幾歲。

sentences.english: SUF is a member of IFIA, the International Federation of Inventors Associations.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典發明者協會是國際發明者聯合會的成員之一。

sentences.english: SUF is a member of IFIA, the International Federation of Inventors Associations.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典發明者協會是國際發明者聯合會的成員之一。

sentences.english: Apple mania has even inspired grass-roots inventors.
sentences.chinese: 對蘋果的癡狂也激發了草根發明者的靈感。

sentences.english: The original system was called DREF after the developer, Dr. Fueher.
sentences.chinese: 最初這種系統稱爲德雷夫，這是發明者的名字。

sentences.english: He was one of the earliest inventors of the motion-picture machine.
sentences.chinese: 他是電影機的最早發明者之一。

sentences.english: He is now regarded as an independent inventor of and contributor to calculus.
sentences.chinese: 他現在被視爲一個獨立的發明者和貢獻者演算。

sentences.english: These include writer James Fenimore Cooper and inventor Samuel Morse.
sentences.chinese: 這些措施包括作家庫柏和發明者塞繆爾莫爾斯。

sentences.english: The god of fire, Hephaestus, was the forger of the thunderbolts of Zeus.
sentences.chinese: 火神赫菲斯托斯是宙斯雷電的發明者。

sentences.english: The invention of 1 Kodak color films is musician.
sentences.chinese: 柯達彩色膠捲的發明者曾是音樂家。

definition: Jobs (name)/see also 史蒂夫·喬布斯|史蒂夫·乔布斯[Shi3 di4 fu1 · Qiao2 bu4 si1], Steve Jobs
lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
to create/to inaugurate/to contrive/to build (a mechanism)
Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
